name: Intravascular Lithotripsy
description: Novel endovascular technique using sonic pressure waves to fracture intimal and medial calcium, allowing vessel expansion while minimizing barotrauma. Based on kidney stone lithotripsy principles, applied to vascular calcification.

mechanism.physics: Sonic pressure waves generated by lithotripsy emitters on balloon catheter
mechanism.action: Pulsatile energy fractures intimal and medial calcium
mechanism.tissue_selectivity: Selectively affects calcified tissue, minimal soft tissue trauma
mechanism.outcome: Creates microfractures in calcium, allows vessel compliance
mechanism.advantage: Low pressure treatment with high efficacy on calcium

shockwave_system.components: Generator, connector cable, catheter with lithotripsy emitters

primary: Severely calcified lesions resistant to balloon expansion
Lesions where high-pressure balloon causes dissection

technique.access: Standard vascular access appropriate to target
technique.wire: Wire across lesion, IVL catheter advanced
technique.inflation: Low pressure (4-6 atm) inflation with contrast

treatment.cycles: 10 pulses per cycle, 30 seconds rest between cycles

technique.adjunctive: Often followed by further dilation, stenting as needed

outcomes.disrupt_trials: Demonstrated efficacy in coronary and peripheral

complications.dissection: Low rate compared to high-pressure balloon

clinical_pearls: IVL fractures calcium without removing plaque - no embolic protection needed
Low-pressure treatment avoids barotrauma and dissection
Can treat medial calcium that atherectomy cannot reach
Visible calcium fractures on fluoro confirm treatment efficacy
learning_objectives: Explain the mechanism of intravascular lithotripsy
Compare IVL to atherectomy for calcified lesion treatment
Describe proper IVL technique and expected outcomes

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
